results.title: Directing a film: Ionesco's 'The New tenant'
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Larry Yust
results.brief_description: To better acquaint students with the role of the director in motion picture production, this film takes them behind the scenes both before and during the filming of Eugene Ionesco’s play “The New Tenant”. Scenes from the early stages of planning and preparation are intercut with scenes from the completed film version of the play to enable students to better understand how the director’s initial thoughts and ideas are realized.

results.title: Dipping sheep
results.brief_description: Stresses the importance, at dipping time, of making a clean muster and dipping all sheep on the property. The importance of keeping sheep in the bath for a sufficient length of time and the necessity of following the manufacturer’s instructions when mixing the dip are also stressed. Various types of spray plants and plunge dips are shown.

results.title: Diplomacy and deceit
results.creator_credit: Peter Morgan, Per-Eric Hawthorn and Independent Television News (GB)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Best of Lateline”.
Provides students with the inside story of how the Western powers failed to stop the conflict in the Balkans. Key political figures reveal what happened behind the scenes. It examines the continuing communist influence in what was once an Eastern Bloc country, the failure of diplomacy to end the conflict and the absence of Western military intervention.

results.title: Diplomacy
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Ian Dunlop
results.brief_description: The history of the diplomat’s functions and skills. The commentary includes quotations from figures as contrasted as Demosthenes, Machiavelli, and President Kennedy. Shows how the modern career diplomat exercises techniques developed over centuries, but today is supported by the resources of modern technology. He must have qualities of patience, integrity and a strong sense of national purpose. Narrated by Alastair Duncan.

results.title: Dionne quintuplets
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation, Donald Brittain, Peter Katadotis and Paul Wright
results.brief_description: Back in 1934, Elzire Dionne delivered five identical girls. This documentary follows Cecile, Emilie, Marie, Yvonne and Annette through twenty one years of strange upbringing. When the girls were just infants, the premier of Ontario issued a court order removing them from their parent’s care. Cut off from the world and their family, over-publicised, viewed twice daily in a special viewing compound, they grew up as prize exhibits. Director Donald Brittain uses newsreel footage, home movie sequences and interviews to depict a historic event that became a tragic exploitation of a family.

results.title: Dinosaurs: the terrible lizards
results.creator_credit: Wah Chang and Charles Cahill and Associates
results.brief_description: Uses special effects and models to recreate the age of the dinosaurs. Gives an overview of what they looked like, what they ate, and how they lived and died. Suitable for lower and upper primary levels.

results.title: Dinosaurs: the age of the terrible lizard
results.brief_description: An animated film which presents an overview of the dinosaur age, showing the major types of dinasaurs and some of their behavioural characteristics. Gives evidence of evolutionary development and indicates a possible reason for their becoming extinct. Edited version of film “Dinozaury”.

results.title: Dinosaurs: fun, facts and fantasy
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Craddock, Clive Doig and Picture Palace Productions
results.brief_description: This informative and entertaining program is a mixture of puppets, songs, animated models, drawings, old film footage and dramatised sequences, and it will answer everything you ever wanted to know about dinosaurs.

results.title: Dinosaurs
results.creator_credit: Steve Skok, Curriculum Branch, Ministry of Ed, Schools Div, Victoria and Peter Bence
results.brief_description: Fossil records show that the dinosaurs were an enormously successful group containing many species. This program examines the reasons why they were so prolific and discusses some of the theories behind their disappearance.

results.title: Dinosaur tracks
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Johnson and friends”.
Johnson and his friends get together in six stories. In “Diesel tries to fly” all the toys are put in danger as Diesal tries out his wings. Squeaky’s good at guarding the bedroom but what about the “Dinosaur tracks”? Is Johnson falling apart as the toys follow the mysterious “Pink thread.” “Melissa’s dinosaur”, Victoria is introduced to the toys. In “Diesel who?”, the toy loses his memory after a nasty crash. McDuff feels very superior after a visit to the toyshop, and the toys try to get her back to her old self in The Homecoming.
